intro: Gnaphalium argyrolepis, commonly known as silverleaf false heather, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and silver-gray foliage. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, which give it a silvery appearance and help reduce water loss. The flowers are usually yellow or white and bloom in late summer to early autumn.
